title: Might and Magic IX - Writ of Fate (ClonedCD)
description:
Might and Magic IX - Writ of Fate (ClonedCD)

Might and Magic IX is a role-playing video game, the last developed by New World Computing for Microsoft Windows and released in 2002 by the 3DO Company. It is the sequel to Might and Magic VIII: Day of the Destroyer. It is the final installment of the original Might and Magic series to date, and the first to feature a significant game engine overhaul since 1998's Might and Magic VI: The Mandate of Heaven. Powered by the Lithtech 1.5 engine, it was also the first game in the series to feature fully three-dimensional graphics. During production, it was known by the working title of Might and Magic IX: Writ of Fate,[1] and it is usually referred to by that title by fans of the series.

The music soundtrack is by Paul Anthony Romero, Rob King and Steve Baca.

Web Seed support: YES

Note: use unecm.exe (included in archive) to decompress MM9_DISK1.img.ecm and MM9_DISK2.img.ecm (simply drag and drop ecm file over unecm.exe icon, or use command line (eg. unecm MM9_DISK2.img.ecm  )

inluded patches:
MM9_1.0to1.2.exe + unofficial patch Patch v1.2 to v1.3 (TELP13.exe)
